channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023090349
item.description:
Report E-2023090349

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: Connersville
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While drums were in storage it was noticed that liquid had leaked onto a skid. The employee found a drum with a pinhole in it. They were able to transfer the material and cleaned up the mess in house. Only a very small amount was lost.

item.title: Report E-2023090348
item.description:
Report E-2023090348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN2929 Sulfix 9272 Scavenger release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to the tote being punctured by another pallet. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted trailer floor was cleaned with absorbents. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 of the metal 5 gallon pails of weldon (un1133) had fallen and had released a total of 5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched,

item.title: Report E-2023070874
item.description:
Report E-2023070874

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-23
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/23/2023, at 0924, CSXT personnel in the Avon Yard discovered ICCX74001, a residue Covered Hopper car last contained NA3077, Hazardous Waste Solid, N.O.S. Spent Catalyst, Class 9 PGIII, leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and shipper, Shell Canada, LTD, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2023-07-23-00012). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a slow leak from the bottom outlet flange at the bottom of the chute. The issue was identified as loose flange bolts and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper representative, Jeffery Bowes, 403-465-0547, jeffrey.bowes@shell.com with Shell Emergency Management. Contractor personnel secured the outlet flange by tightening the flange bolts tool tight and decontaminating the impacted area. The leak was secured and the car was released back into transportation. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 not required.

item.title: Report X-2023081263
item.description:
Report X-2023081263

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081263 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGUALTED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET/DAMAGED. INTERNAL LEAKAGE DUE TO FAILURE OF 4 X 1-GAL PLASTIC BOTTLE CAPS. INSIDE CONTENTS CONTAIN CORROSIVE LIQUIDS. LOOSE CAP OF 1-GAL BOTTLE FAILED, BALANCE RETURN TO SHIPPER. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES. 2. X-2023081264 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET. 4 X 1-GAL BOTTLES FAILED AT TOP CAPS CAUSING AN INTERAL LEAKAGE. BAL RTS. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report I-2023090011
item.description:
Report I-2023090011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: Indianapolis
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Minibulk driver was unloading the product into the customer's tank while a customefs employee was monitoring the gauge on the tank(because the gauge was not visable from the truck). The customer wanted as much product in the tank and waited too long to tell our driver to stop the flow of product, causing 10 gallons to overflow from the tank into containment. The overflow lasted approxiamately 10 seconds.
